title: Loa Pack Manifest
description: Schema for construct pack manifest.json files. Defines pack metadata, skills, commands, events, tool dependencies, and health probes. Extends the existing pack format with event-driven construct coordination (RFC #162).

slug.description: URL-safe pack identifier (kebab-case). Used as directory name and in event source references.

version.description: Semantic version. Major bumps for breaking event schema changes, minor for new events/skills, patch for fixes.

skills.description: Skills provided by this pack. Each skill SHOULD have an index.yaml for natural language triggers.

commands.description: Slash commands provided by this pack

events.description: Event declarations for inter-construct communication. The emits/consumes topology enables workflow chaining, dependency visualization, and dead-letter detection.

emits.description: Events this pack produces. Each event SHOULD have a schema defining its data payload. Think of this as the pack's public API surface for downstream consumers.

consumes.description: Events this pack subscribes to. Consumer-driven contracts (Pact pattern) can be specified to prevent upstream breaking changes.

tools.description: External tool dependencies. Declarative only â€” Loa does NOT auto-install. The loader checks tool availability and warns users. Inspired by loa-constructs field report (Issue #162, @zkSoju).

meta_probe.description: Health check probe for internal coherence. Maps to the existing beads-health.sh pattern but standardized across construct systems.

loa_version.description: Required Loa version constraint (semver range, e.g., '>=1.20.0')

packs.description: Required packs that must be installed

dependencies.description: Pack dependencies. Version constraints follow semver range syntax.

path.description: Relative path to skill directory from pack root
Relative path to command markdown file

install.description: Installation command. Displayed to user, never auto-executed. Security boundary: Loa shows this as guidance, user decides whether to run it.

required.description: Whether the pack functions without this tool. If true, affected skills are blocked when tool is missing.

purpose.description: Human-readable explanation of why this tool is needed

check.description: Command to verify tool is installed (e.g., 'agent-browser --version'). Exit code 0 = installed.

command.description: Slash command to trigger the probe (e.g., '/pulse')

skill.description: Skill slug that implements the health check

scope.description: Whether the probe is pack-internal or externally accessible

examples.name: GTM Collective
examples.description: Go-To-Market skills and commands for product launches, positioning, and developer relations.

emits.name: gtm.market_analysis_complete
emits.description: Fired when market analysis produces actionable insights
